newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha firm, supply tighter, crude/gasoline up.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha firm, supply tighter, crude/gasoline up.

text.p: NWE spot naphtha prices were firmer on Friday lifted by stronger crude and gasoline markets and tight Mediterranean supplies, traders said.
Traders said arbitrage trade to the Far East had drawn heavily on key Algerian and Egyptian naphtha supplies through March.
"All of the March Algerian barrels are set to go east and three of four Egyptian cargoes are heading that way too," a trader said.
Saudi gasoline buying following hefty sales of naphtha into Japan and an open arbitrage for gasoline to the United states were also seen helping to strengthen naphtha.
But traders said buyers would be reluctant to push the market too high for fear of boosting benchmark quotes prices related to cargoes they already had booked to go East.
Despite the gains, buying interest from petrochemical users remained relaxed but traders said they expected the strengthening gasoline market to draw demand from reformers as margins improve.

Physical cargo prices were around $5-8 a tonne firmer but talked in a wider notional range around $190/$197 cif. April paper was bid around $197 but sellers on both spot and paper markets were scarce.
